t: To the choirmaster. Of the Sons of Korah. According to Alamoth. A Song.
God*pn is our refuge and strength, a*ld very present help in trouble.
Therefore*ln we will not fear though the earth gives way, though*ld the mountains be moved into the heart of the sea,
though*ln its waters roar and foam, though*ld the mountains tremble at its swelling. Selah*ig
There*pn is a river whose streams make glad the city of God, the*ld holy habitation of the Most High.
God*ln is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved; God*ld will help her when morning dawns.
The*ln nations rage, the kingdoms totter; he*ld utters his voice, the earth melts.
The*ln Lord*s of hosts is with us; the*ld God of Jacob is our fortress. Selah*ig
Come,*pn behold the works of the Lord,*s how*ld he has brought desolations on the earth.
He*ln makes wars cease to the end of the earth; he*ld breaks the bow and shatters the spear; he*ld burns the chariots with fire.
“Be*ln still, and know that I am God. I*ld will be exalted among the nations, I*ld will be exalted in the earth!”
The*ln Lord*s of hosts is with us; the*ld God of Jacob is our fortress. Selah*ig
